unitName: Inclusivity and partnerships in early childhood education
description: This unit introduces students to the concepts of inclusivity and the ways that family and professional partnerships are an essential element of early years education. It explores the rationales and practices in the early years setting and profession to achieve inclusion for all learners. Students engage in critical analysis of current inclusion and professional partnership practices locally and globally. Within this framework of analysis, the evaluation and application of evidence-based practice in relation to inclusivity and partnership is established. Major theoretical perspectives and current debates related to development are explored and students learn how to interpret and implement curriculum and legislative requirements that impact on professional practice and planning to meet diverse learner needs.
